Nosso grupo tem como missão divulgar, pr: Our group’s mission is to disseminate, preserve, and promote the rich universe of Capoeira, highlighting not only the practice of the game itself but also its associated cultural expressions such as singing, music, and dance. Capoeira is more than a sport or martial art; it is a symbol of our ancestry, a living expression of resistance, and a bond that unites communities for generations.
A Associação Energia Pura Internacional: The Energia Pura International Association is more than a group; we are a family united by a passion for the art and tradition of Capoeira.
A capoeira é uma expressão cultural fasc: Capoeira is a fascinating cultural expression that unites fighting, dance, game, singing, and rhythm. It is an engaging and complete practice, as well as an excellent gateway to the rich Brazilian culture, which we invite you to discover.
são voltados para todas as idades, desde: are designed for all ages, from children to adults, both beginners and experienced practitioners.
Experimente! A primeira aula é gratuita!: Try it! The first class is free!
Originária do Rio de Janeiro, a batucada: Originating in Rio de Janeiro, batucada is a vibrant tradition of Brazilian percussion, deeply rooted in the spirit of carnival and the contagious energy of samba.
o grupo acolhe participantes de todos os: the group welcomes participants of all levels, from beginners to the most experienced.

O ponto alto dessa experiência é a parti: The highlight of this experience is participating in the Carnival parades in French Guiana, alongside the percussion group BATUQUE AE. Together, they create an unforgettable show, full of rhythm, colors, and joy.
Estamos presentes no Brasil, mas também: We are present in Brazil, but we also operate in:
Estamos presentes no Brasil, no estado d: We are present in Brazil, in the state of Amapá, with activities in Macapá, the capital, and in the municipality of Oiapoque, on the border with French Guiana. In addition, we are also in:
Jeremias Belo dos Santos, mais conhecido: Jeremias Belo dos Santos, better known as Gato Preto, was born on April 17, 1980, in Petrolina, Pernambuco.
Iniciei minha trajetória na capoeira aos: I began my journey in capoeira at the age of 4, playing in the Ginga do Corpo Negro group in the Cavaleiro neighborhood of Recife, training with friends under the guidance of my uncle, Instructor Lito, who later became the Master of the Aza Branca group. At 5 years old, I participated in my first batizado, a significant moment that marked my official entry into the world of capoeira. When Master Lito left for São Paulo, I continued training in Recife with the group's advanced students and later in Maceió, Salvador, and São Paulo in 1989. Along this journey, I encountered various other capoeira groups, which allowed me to further enhance my techniques.
Em 1990, formamos um grupo de apresentaç: In 1990, we formed a performance group with other advanced students from the Ginga do Corpo Negro group and traveled across Brazil showcasing our art. In 1992, I traveled with my brother Borrachinha and Professor Estivador through the northern part of the country, passing through Belém, Manaus, and Macapá. At that time, capoeira was still relatively unknown in the region, so we decided to start teaching. In 1998, we expanded our horizons and traveled to French Guiana, then to Martinique, Guadeloupe, and finally Paris, where we gave several performances during the Football World Cup.
Ao retornar ao Brasil, permaneci em Maca: Upon returning to Brazil, I stayed in Macapá to continue my work in capoeira, founding the Malê group. In 1999, we created the Malê Capoeira Association with Borrachinha and Estivador, which was dissolved in 2002 due to disagreements with Master Estivador.
Após isso, voltei a Recife, onde fui for: After that, I returned to Recife, where I was certified as a teacher by Master João Mulatinho, president of the Capoeira Federation of Pernambuco, and passed the teacher's exam, receiving support and recognition from many masters. In July 2003, I participated in an international capoeira meeting organized by the São Salomão and Alto Astral groups. The positive energy from these events and the encouragement from various masters inspired me to found the Energia Pura capoeira group on August 25, 2003. I returned to Macapá and created the Energia Pura Association with the goal of expanding the practice of capoeira in Amapá and making it recognized throughout Brazil. In 2004, responding to requests from students and graduates like Camaleão (from the Malê group), we established branches of the Energia Pura Association in Martinique and in Cayenne, French Guiana, with the collaboration of instructors Jamanta and Borrachinha, who had been my students in Macapá.
Desde 2005, dedico três meses por ano ao: Since 2005, I have dedicated three months each year to teaching capoeira in Trento, Italy. On July 13, 2007, I received the title of Contra-Mestre from the Capoeira Federation of Pernambuco after an internship with Master Mulatinho.
Hoje, tanto no Brasil quanto na França,: Today, both in Brazil and France, the students of the Energia Pura Association are deeply engaged, and we have numerous projects to develop capoeira, promoting it both educationally and culturally.
